titleStmt.title: The copie of a letter, sent from the Commander in Chiefe, of the town and port of Plymouth, to the Honourable William Lenthall, Esq. Speaker of the House of Commons: concerning the late great fight at Mount Stanford. Together, with a true relation of the persons there killed; and what condition the said towne and port now are in. Also a copie of the vovv and covenant, which all the deputy lieutenants, commanders, townesmen, and souldiers took, to live and dye in defence of the said town. Ordered by the Commons assembled in Parliament, that this letter and protestation, be forthwith printed and published. Hen. Elsynge Cler. Parl. D. Com.
titleStmt.author: Wardlace, James.
England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Edward Husbands, and are to be sold at his shop in the middle Temple,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: following Novemb. 91 in imprint, Thomason has inserted "19th".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop in the middle Temple
